issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The create launch config wizard and launch instance wizards should allow one or more security groups to be added. Detail and landing pages need to display more than one as well.
fields.summary: Create Launch config and launch instance wizards won't allow adding more than one security group

comments.body: same as launch instance wizard

[~jloza] [~kgill] Pull request has been created for the UX review:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/508

The same change needs to be applied to the launch instance wizard, but before going further, we will need to understand the impact of this update due to the level of changes in the display and the UX.
[~jloza] [~kgill] Sorry to bug you on your vacation. This review can wait until next week. Enjoy!

Hi [~kyolee], if you look at the wireframe for https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Launch+instance+wizard+-+refreshed the notes for this step indicate that the whole rule block should be repeated for each security group that's added, but it looks like only the rules are being repeated. I have three security groups added to my LC, and the rules are all shown, but the test above indicates these rules all apply only to the last security group added. The rules should be separated into each security group, under that group's name (i.e. the whole block should be repeated), please.

For a group like default that has no rules, one a second group is added, the rules display under the "Incoming traffic rules for security group default:" part should read "None defined".

Also, I noticed the security group name in the text block when there are no rules defined is a link, but it shouldn't be in this case. We don't want someone accidentally clicking it and losing all the work they have put into their wizards (here and launch instance). The text says they can go fix their rules afterwardI was going to write a separate bug for that, but can you just fix that here instead, since it's such an easy fix, please?

Currently, with the given structure of the wizard and the panels, only the rules of the last security group added are showing on the display. If we are to modify the "rule preview panel" and the wizard to display all the rules added, then it would potentially stretching down the wizard, thus it might not necessarily provide nice UX experience, but I will first investigate if this work can be done easily by reusing the existing panels.

And, for hiding the warning when a second group is added, this will need to wait until the step above can be implemented.

Finally, the link on the previous display will open another window for the specified security group, thus the user will still maintain the current wizard view.

Hi [~kyolee] sounds good with the link opening the second window. Thanks! That's awesome. :)

I am not overly concerned with overstretching the wizard when displaying all the rules, since folks likely won't be adding a bunch of security groups at once. Probably just a few. Should be OK. We can always add a "show more rules" link after the wizard hits the fold to allow them the option of showing them without expanding it to hugeness at first (would need an associated "show less rules" link when expanded)
[~jloza] The adjustments in the comment above have been added to the pull request, and ready for UX review again.
Thanks, [~kyolee], will check it out. The best way to be sure things get my attention would also be to assign the ticket to me and put it into In Review in Jira as well, please.
Looks great, [~kyolee]! If this has passed code review and everything already please feel free to move to QA. :)
[~kyolee]: Per a discussion during the UI weekly meeting, we're going to need to back out the changes in 4.0.0 and punt this to a later release.  Apologies for the confusion!

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/535

to revert the previous commits
[~jloza] Will need wire-frames for adding and displaying multiple security groups for the launch config and instance launch wizards, LC and instance landing page, and LC and instance detail page.
assigned to jenny for wireframing multiple sg rule (ingress and egress) display on wizards. Other stuff is already wireframed and ready to go.
wireframes updated and ready to go!

UX review is ready at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/901

launch wizards:

* select text should match (in text and style) what is shown in the key pair selection widget in the same dialog, please
* accordion does not display for selected SG if no rules are applied. 
* warning icon not displaying for SG with no rules
[~jloza] Couldn't reproduce the case where the selected security group preview didn't display the +/- sign. Will need more information on the environment for this error.

The pull request has been updated for UX review:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/901

* Select text still does not match key pair selection in styling, it should look like the key pair select text does. Screenshot attached. Please ask me if you do not know what is required here. 
* please work with [~kgill] to get the warning icon to be more legible (key line, color, etc) and also to get info indented under the accordions for readability.

Clarified case where accordion wasn't displaying, thanks for fixing that.

[~jloza] The select text appears on the keypair selection is an actual option where the select text for the security group is displayed as a data-placeholder, thus not part of the options. In case of non-selectable option, it is preferred that the message to be displayed as the placeholder, rather than creating an actual option item, which has no valid value. Let me know if you still like to use the option as the display text.

The warning icon displayed is what's provided by Foundation. Please be more specific on what's to be improved for the icon display.

In addition regarding the select option above, keep in mind that the security group field is now a multiple select field; due to the behavior of the multiple select field, having "Select.." as an option would allow "Select.." item to be selected and displayed on the inputbox.

See the first screenshot added to see this case.

Plus, turns out that it is not possible to have the "Select..." option to be displayed for the mutiple select field for it is required "data-placeholder" to be used as the default display message.

For the warning icon's display, it appears that changing the color of the icon form yellow to orange makes it more stand out in the white background. See the second screenshot added above.

As far as the size of the icon, it's already in the class "large", which matches the size of the capital letter R in the same row.
reassigning to [~kgill] so he can address these issues.
[~kyolee] and [~kgill] the orange color of the icon does help. [~kgill] is there anything additional we can do? can we do black exclamation point on orange?
[~kgill] The merge conflicts have been resolved on the branch.

[~kgill] remaining leftover UX things kyo needed help with are:

* "select..." text styling in security group selection box looks different than it does in the key pair selection box. They should be consistent. Worst case scenario, remove the text completely and give an empty box. 
* warning icon legibility: improved by going orange, anything else we can do to improve legibility? Black exclamation point, perhaps? Can you also please add a "Warning! No rules defined" tooltip for that icon?
* rule blocks under accordions could stand to be indented a little bit like in the wireframe for readability, please. 

Thanks for helping with these things!
The indentation issue has been fixed, and see the previous comments for the SelectMultipleField's data-placeholder issue on 'Select..' text display.
Thanks, [~kyolee], indentation looks good

[~jloza]: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/901 has been updated to include the remaining style fixes and is ready for a final UX review.

/cc [~kyolee]
UX review passed. Ready for code review.
[~kgill] The branch has been updated to address the test failure issue, and is now ready to be merged.
Pull request 901 merged

Verified fixed.
